tldr: Q2 2025 delivered 5% organic sales growth and adjusted EPS of $2.75, beating guidance with orders up 6% and backlog at $36.6B. Management raised full-year sales and EPS guidance while factoring tariffs, completed the PPE divestiture, and highlighted portfolio moves including the Johnson Matthey Catalyst Technologies deal and a building automation tuck-in.
bullets: Organic sales grew 5% with adjusted EPS up 10% to $2.75; orders rose 6% to $10.5B and backlog reached $36.6B.
Aerospace grew 6% organically (margin 25.5%); industrial automation was flat (margin 19.2%); building automation grew 8% (margin +90 bps); ESS grew 6% led by UOP.
Guidance raised: FY organic sales growth 4% to 5% (3% to 4% ex-Bombardier), sales $40.8B-$41.3B; Q3 sales $10.0B-$10.3B and EPS $2.50-$2.60.
themes: Asset visibility and data capture adoption expanding
Pricing and cost pressure shaping margins
Industrial and logistics demand uneven by region

segments.title: Aerospace Technologies
points: Organic sales rose 6% led by defense and space and commercial aftermarket strength.
Segment margin declined 170 bps to 25.5% on cost inflation and CASE integration.

segments.title: Industrial Automation
points: Organic sales were flat with better sensing and warehouse automation offset by softer PSS and PPE.
Segment margin expanded 20 bps to 19.2% on productivity and commercial excellence.

segments.title: Building Automation
points: Organic sales grew 8% across solutions and products with strong regional demand.
Margin expanded 90 bps on volume leverage and access solutions accretion.

segments.title: Energy and Sustainability Solutions
points: Organic sales grew 6% led by double-digit UOP growth.
Margin headwinds from cost inflation and a customer settlement offset LNG benefits.

notes.title: Portfolio actions
points: Agreed to acquire Johnson Matthey Catalyst Technologies (GBP 1.8B) with close expected in H1 2026.
Announced Lion Tammer tuck-in for building automation and launched strategic alternatives review for PSS and WWS.

notes.title: Tariffs and pricing
points: Guidance assumes tariffs announced to date with mitigation via productivity and pricing actions.
Margin pressure in aero reflects tariff-driven cost inflation with pricing lag.

themes.title: Demand contingency and orders
points: Management said order trends improved sequentially with strong aerospace orders.
Energy projects and catalyst timing remain the primary source of uncertainty.

themes.title: Aerospace OE and margin outlook
points: Commercial OE revenue softness was described as transitory with expectations for improvement in H2.
Aero margins are expected to recover as pricing catches up to inflation.

top_questions.question: What is driving the more cautious second-half posture?
top_questions.summary: Management cited tariff uncertainty and delayed energy project and catalyst timing despite strong H1 orders.

top_questions.question: How should investors view IA short-cycle trends?
top_questions.summary: Orders held up better than feared, but management remains cautious on China-exposed short-cycle businesses.

top_questions.question: Why was free cash flow guidance unchanged after raising EPS?
top_questions.summary: Inventory build in aerospace is expected to normalize later in the year, offsetting higher earnings.

implications: Catalyst Technologies acquisition expands UOP exposure to sustainable fuels and should raise long-term ESS growth.
Strategic alternatives for PSS and WWS could reshape the automation portfolio and improve mix.
competitive_notes: Building automation momentum and access solutions accretion point to share gains in key verticals.
forecast_hooks: Track Q3 conversion of energy backlog and catalyst shipment timing.
Watch aero pricing actions versus tariff cost inflation in the second half.

action_items: Validate UOP catalyst demand and sustainable fuels pipeline with channel checks.
Monitor PPE exit benefits on IA margins and organic growth in the second half.
open_questions: Timing and regulatory milestones for the Catalyst Technologies acquisition.
Outcome and timing for the PSS and WWS strategic alternatives review.
watch_next_quarter: Q3 organic sales delivery versus the 2% to 4% guide range.
Backlog conversion in aerospace and energy projects.
